events.message: The customer reported a vehicle accident that occurred on the morning of May 1st. They submitted initial details about the collision involving their car and another vehicle at a traffic intersection.
Upon reviewing the incident description, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to the nature of the vehicle collision and damage reported.
An insurance agent was assigned immediately to the case to assist the claimant through the process, providing direct contact for support and next steps.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed the details with the customer, ensuring their report was properly logged and understood.
The agent requested additional documents including the police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and the claimant’s driver’s license to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all required documents promptly, including the official police report and detailed images of the collision damage from multiple angles.
An internal investigation was commenced to assess the liability and extent of damage caused during the car accident, with input from accident reconstruction experts.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault, and the damage assessment report was finalized outlining repair costs and recommended settlements.
Based on the investigation findings, a fair settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering vehicle repair expenses and rental car reimbursement.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the responsiveness of the insurance support team during the entire claims process.
Following acceptance of the settlement by the customer, the claim was formally approved and processed for payment without any outstanding issues.
The payment covering the vehicle repair costs was issued to the repair shop as per agreement, ensuring the customer could begin restoring their car without delay.
The claim was officially closed after confirming all payments were completed and the customer reported satisfactory repair outcomes for their vehicle.
All case files and documentation related to the auto accident claim were archived according to company policy for future reference and record keeping.
